fibonacci_by_continuation.py

00001 #!/usr/bin/python
00002 
00003 """
00004 A Fibonacci series using continuations
00005 From: http://www.intertwingly.net/blog/2005/04/13/Continuations-for-Curmudgeons
00006 """
00007 import sys
00008 
00009 def fibonacci():
00010       yield 0
00011       i, j = 0, 1
00012       while True:
00013           yield j
00014           i, j = j, i+j
00015 
00016 max = 10
00017 if len(sys.argv) > 1:
00018     max = int(sys.argv[1])
00019 
00020 for n in fibonacci():
00021       print n, # adds a space before the next print unless there's a sys.stdout.write
00022       if n > max: break
00023       sys.stdout.write(", ")
00024 print
00025 
00026 fib = fibonacci()
00027 for i in range(1, max + 1):
00028     print "%2d: %s" % (i, fib.next())
